hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Shihab: The companions used to pray on Friday until Umar ibn al-Khattab came out. When Umar came out and sat on the minbar, the muezzins gave the call to prayer. Thaalabah said: We sat talking, and when the muezzins finished and Umar stood up to deliver the sermon, we became silent and no one from us spoke. Ibn Shihab said: The coming out of the imam cuts off the prayer, and his speaking cuts off speech.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Malik ibn Abi Amir: Uthman ibn Affan used to say in his sermon, and he rarely left this when he preached: If the imam stands to deliver the sermon on Friday, listen and be silent. For the one who is silent but does not hear has a share like the one who is silent and listening. When the prayer starts, straighten the rows and align the shoulders, for straightening the rows is part of the perfection of prayer. Then do not say the takbir until men come to whom he has assigned the task of straightening the rows, and they inform him that the rows are straight, then he says the takbir.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Shihab: One who catches one unit of the Friday prayer should pray another unit with it. Ibn Shihab said: This is the Sunnah. Malik said: This is what I found the people of knowledge in our city were upon, and this is because the Prophet ﷺ said: Whoever catches one unit of prayer has caught the prayer. Malik said: Regarding one who is crushed in the crowd on Friday and bows but cannot prostrate until the imam stands or finishes prayer: If he is able to prostrate when the people stand, let him prostrate. If he cannot prostrate until the imam finishes the prayer, then I prefer that he begins the Dhuhr prayer with four units.

hadiths.english_translation: Chapter: What has been mentioned about the imam descending in a village on Friday in the morning
Topics: Imam descending in a village on Friday morning

hadiths.english_translation: Malik said: When the imam descends in a village where Friday prayer becomes obligatory, they must pray Friday prayer with him. If he descends in the forenoon and they pray Friday prayer with him, then their Friday prayer is done. If he remains there to the time of Friday prayer, then Friday prayer becomes obligatory for them. If someone who was present and did not pray Friday prayer with them comes to them during that day, he must pray it, and whoever comes to them after that needs to consider the situation based on what has been established.

hadiths.english_translation: Abu Hurayrah said: I met Basrah ibn Abi Basrah al-Ghifari. He asked me: What have you heard from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ about the day of Friday? I said: I heard him say: The supplication is answered on the day of Friday, the whole of it is an hour of answered supplication. So if you make supplication then, you will be answered. He said: This is what I heard from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ.

hadiths.english_translation: Abu Hurayrah said: Then I met Abdullah ibn Salam. I asked him: What have you heard from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ about Friday? He said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ mentioned Friday and said: In it is an hour in which no servant asks Allah for something except that He grants it to him, and I saw it being the hour when the imam sits on the minbar until the prayer ends. He said: I tested this with my knowledge, and I found it to be the last hour before the prayer ends.

hadiths.english_translation: Abu Hurayrah said: How can it be the entire day when the Prophet ﷺ said it is an hour? And he explained: The one who speaks truth is the one who says it is from when the imam sits until the prayer ends. As for what I said about it being the entire day, I did not mean the literal entire day, but I meant that supplication is answered throughout the entire day of Friday.
